item.title: Thoughts on Westworld
item.description: Over time, repetition becomes variation. Westworld (2016) managed to hold my attention for more than 6 episodes – 6 (now 9) hours that I feel must result in a product, or at least a short introspective into what held my attention in the series where I drift off drastically in others. Here are a few thoughts: Total surveillance is mundane. There are no moments where surveillance becomes a source of horror.
